Yes. I love this idea, similar to the strikers with the fungus or pigs with carrots

This upgrade would turn the Happy Ghast into a truly viable and exciting mode of mass transit. I propose using the name Thrust for this speed-boosting enchantment. This name captures the enchantment's function of propelling the Ghast forward with increased velocity.
Then they could finally use ghast/affectionate_scream.ogg in game as either the noise the whistle makes, or the noise the ghast makes when it hears the call.

I've had some success in building steps & catwalks to get them up to higher chests, would be nice if they could reach down a couple blocks from them too. similarly though even in small storage rooms, once there's more than 10 chests they are liable to get stuck in a loop. they need some kind of "memory" so as not to search the same chests that they have already done, so while holding their current item.
This idea is cool, but it seems more like it belongs in a mod.
Adding this would improve the utility of camels. Right now they are mostly awkward horses.

Camels have several practical applications that you don't get with other mounted animals, and thus similar to horses don't have the ability to carry an inventory. This makes sense for balancing reasons atm, but the argument should perhaps be that this balancing could need a rework.

Ideally all mounts should be able to act as pack animals, perhaps at the expense of not being able to be mounted or equipped with armor if there's items in the inventory (this seems to be a viable next step given the recent improvements to the leashes functionality); though current pack animals should probably be exempt from such restrictions to give them an edge as pack animals. The current balancing should also be made more consistent, for example making the llamas individual random strength attribute an universal factor among the mounts.

My +1 vote is therefore with the notion of a proper rebalancing and consistency check on mounts in general, or "better mounts" if you will. And if nothing else let Camels at least drop leather. ;P

yes something similar to a "memory" of any chest already searched while holding the current item. I found playing around in the preview that having a copper golem working in a storage room with only 15 chests (arranged in a u-shape 5 chests per side the copper chest in the middle) could result in the golem getting stuck in a loop searching the same 10 chests over & over. In the current state they don't seem functional for even an early game storage room.

Love the new copper golem, but the randomness with which it opens chests can interfere with item sorting. If it consistently opened chests beginning with the one closest to the copper chest and then the next closest and so on, it would make item sorting more reliable. An item-sorting setup works best when the CG checks the copper chest, then the next, up to the tenth which is outfitted with a hopper to carry unmatched items to another CG's sorting area. But if the CG checks chests randomly, it may encounter the "empty" hopper chest before an earlier chest already containing the matching item, thereby sending the item on to an end-of-the-line overflow chest where it would need to be returned to the input chest for resorting. Please consider adding a priority system to the chests checked by the copper golem.

Bronze is made with tin, while there are iron-copper alloys those are used in electronics and things like springs. I recommend redoing this suggestion and giving some uses for tin aside from making bronze so that the item has multiple uses instead of only one (alloying). The devs, for example, could add tin (and bronze) items that are decorative like new torch-, candleholders, wardrobes that work as alternatives for chests and look nice. Things like that.
